data.showtitle: Return of the Curse of Timeland
data.shownotes: This show was billed as Return of the Curse of Timeland (a rescheduling of their cancelled 2021 New Year's Eve Timeland Festival) and featured the debuts of Magenta Mountain, The Garden Goblin, The Dripping Tap, and Soy-Protein Munt Machine. Timeland was played over the PA as the pre-show music. A model of London’s Big Ben clock tower, approximately 20 ft (6 m) tall, with the words “Time is Ephemeral” and “Music is Ephemeral” written on the clock’s face was erected in the back right corner of the stage.  The clock hands ran forward at an accelerated pace throughout the show.  Am I in Heaven? contained Rattlesnake teases and Boogieman Sam quotes/teases. Evil Death Roll contained Robot Stop teases. Trapdoor was played for the first time known since 2016-09-09. (259 show gap) The Dripping Tap was introduced as a song about a tap that won’t stop dripping.  Smoke & Mirrors was played over the PA as the setbreak music. Hot Wax was played for the first time since 2018-06-20. (114 show gap) Gaia featured a drum solo by Cavs. Rattlesnake contained Boogieman Sam quotes and featured another Cavs drum solo, during which the band destroyed the clock tower presiding over the stage and passed out the pieces into the crowd. The on-stage carnage appears to have extended to some of the band’s equipment, as the final portion of Rattlesnake was performed with Joey playing the FMB and Stu singing with no instrument.
data.opener: Babe Rainbow, Stonefield, Ajak Kwai, Nice Biscuit, Bones & Jones w/Folk BItch Trio

data.shownotes: This show featured the debut of Blame It On the Weather. I’m Not In Your Mind contained Rattlesnake teases and Boogieman Sam quotes. Gaia featured a drum solo by Cavs. Mystery Jack was introduced as the oldest song that would be played that night, followed by a tease of “Frankenstein” (Edgar Winter Group). Mystery Jack was played for the first time since 2018-11-24 (86 show gap). Ataraxia was on the written setlist but was replaced by Doom City. Following O.N.E. opening band Body Type was shouted out. The Dripping Tap featured a “flute jam” duet between Stu and Cecil Coleman of Body Type and contained Pill teases and Cellophane teases/quotes.
Hell was introduced as a song about L.A.  Automation was introduced as a song about the near-term future.

The show began with a chant of “fuck shit up” by the crowd, which was repeated several times throughout the show. Self-Immolate was introduced as a song about setting yourself on fire. Before starting Magenta Mountain the crowd’s chant was changed to “ma-gen-ta.” Slow Jam 1 contained Iron Lung quotes. Supreme Ascendancy was introduced as a song about “how much Amby loves our lord and savior…Satan!” SPELLLING and The Chats were shouted out after Oddlife. Following Ontology Stu and the audience had a discussion of the apple that Stu was eating during the show. The Lord of Lightning contained a Cellophane tease. Before Dead-Beat, Stu announced that they would be playing an older song. This announcement prompted several requests from the audience, including God is in the Rhythm, “Taste of an Orange” (Almacknjack) and “Stairway to Heaven” (Led Zeppelin) which was then teased by Joey, who then claimed that he had no idea how to play that song and referred to it as Stairway to Kevin. Am I in Heaven? contained Her and I (Slow Jam 2) teases, God Is Calling Me Back Home teases, The Dripping Tap teases/quotes, Boogieman Sam teases/quotes, Rattlesnake teases, Hot Wax quotes and Head On/Pill teases/quotes. KGLW.net Staff Notes: Special shout out to our very own @spidzzle for the recording located on Archive.org!
data.venuename: Event Lawn at Virgin Hotels Las Vegas

data.shownotes: The show opened with an expression of disdain for the visiting New Orleans Pelicans of the NBA, who defeated the Phoenix Suns in a first-round playoff game earlier in the evening. Planet B was started and stopped several times before the full song was played. Honey contained Doom City teases. Sleep Drifter contained Billabong Valley quotes. The Bitter Boogie contained Presumptuous quotes and featured Stu feeding chips and salsa to the band and throwing chips out to the audience.

Rattlesnake contained O.N.E. teases. Following Sea of Trees an audience member gave Stu a slap bracelet which he put on and then returned. Slow Jam 1 contained an Iron Lung jam with lyrics. Poster By Jason Galea Edition of 100

Robot Stop had teases of Hot Water and People-Vultures. Before The Dripping Tap, Joey shouted out Trent Reznor of Nine Inch Nails, calling him "talented and hot", and Ambrose quoted "The Stroke" (Billy Squier). People-Vultures was on the printed setlist after Gamma Knife but not played.

Honey had teases from Billabong Valley and Sleep Drifter. Boogieman Sam had Cut Throat Boogie quotes. The Dripping Tap had I'm in your Mind quotes. After Honey, Stu says "give us that Tool beat", then says he was thinking of the wrong song and asks for that "Ginger Baker beat". Tezeta was played for the first time since 2019-10-07. (54 show gap) During Boogieman Sam, Stu was throwing some kind of food into the crowd, feeding it to the band, as well as tossing it in the air and catching it in his mouth.

3 hour marathon set. Before the show, "Timeland" was played on the speakers. The intro to Nuclear Fusion was done by the band's sound tech Gaspard. Mr. Beat contained a Persistence tease. Billabong Valley contained a Sleep Drifter tease. During the setbreak, "Smoke & Mirrors" was also played via the venue's speakers. I'm Not In Your Mind contained a Dripping Tap tease. Gaia featured a drum solo. Cellophane featured Stu on flute. The River was dedicated to "Ambrose's ass" and the second segment was played faster per Stu's request. Work This Time featured a guitar solo. Before The Dripping Tap, Stu shouted out the band's crew. The Dripping Tap contained Iron Lung quotes. Mystery Jack was on the setlist after The River, but not played due to time constraints. 

Poster By Jake Foreman

I'm Not In Your Mind contained Am I In Heaven? and The Dripping Tap teases. The Balrog was played for the first time since 2019-10-16 (50 show gap). Wah Wah contained The River teases and Big Fig Wasp teases and quotes. Boogieman Sam contained Cut Throat Boogie quotes, Cyboogie quotes, “Got My Mojo Working” (Ann Cole) quotes, “Going Up the Country” (Canned Heat) quotes, “My Babe” (Little Walter) quotes, and a "La Grange" (ZZ Top) tease, as well as Stu on flute. Float Along - Fill Your Lungs contained a metal jam. KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist for this show is believed to be complete. Portions of Gaia and Magenta Mountain through Float Along - Fill Your Lungs have been confirmed via audio/video recordings. The remaining songs were confirmed via the written setlist for the show and contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (guest appearances, segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net.

Superbug (lyric changed from “H1N1” to “Coronavirus” referencing COVID-19). Inner Cell was dedicated to the former Australian Prime Minister Scott Morrison, who had lost an election that day. Inner Cell was played for the first time since 2019-10-15 (54 show gap), and Loyalty and Horology were played for the first time since 2019-10-18 (52 show gap). Cut Throat Boogie featured Boogieman Sam teases and quotes, Change teases, “Got My Mojo Working” (Ann Cole) quotes, and “My Babe” (Little Walter) quotes. Persistence featured Change teases and Horology teases. Am I in Heaven? featured Cut Throat Boogie, Hot Water, and Change teases and The Dripping Tap, Iron Lung, Cellophane, Persistence, Sea of Trees, Magenta Mountain, and Ice V teases and quotes. The Lord of Lightning was on the printed setlist after Magenta Mountain but was not played.
data.soundcheck: (possibly incomplete) Inner Cell, Loyalty, Magenta Mountain, Mars for the Rich

data.shownotes: Honey started with a Sleep Drifter intro and contained Sleep Drifter, Nuclear Fusion, and Billabong Valley teases. The River contained Iron Lung teases. Before Gamma Knife, Ambrose quoted "That's not a knife… THAT's a knife." from Crocodile Dundee and the song was introduced as a song about the future of knives. The Bitter Boogie featured Ambrose on sax. The Lord Of Lightning was on the printed setlist before The Bitter Boogie but was not played.

2nd show with Cavs unable to play due to getting COVID. The band played with a drum machine, this time with no CAVS shirt. Magenta Mountain opened with a drum machine jam by Stu. Sadie Sorceress contained a lengthened intro where the band and crowd shouted Cavs. After Most Of What I Like, the band joked they would play Organ Farmer and Gaia with the drum machine next. Slow Jam 1 contained Iron Lung quotes and teases. O.N.E. contained a Honey tease. Muddy Water and Float Along Fill Your Lungs were on the printed setlist at the end, but were cut.

This was the first of five nights in Barcelona for Primavera Sound. Honey contained Sleep Drifter and Rattlesnake teases. The printed setlist contained a different song order - 'Self-Immolate' first and 'Mars for the Rich' second. KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist for this show is believed to be complete. Gaia through Honey, Magenta Mountain, and The Dripping Tap have been confirmed via audio/video recordings. The remaining songs were confirmed via the physical written setlist and contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (guest appearances, segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net.

The Dripping Tap contained a Cellophane tease. During The Dripping Tap, Stu crowd-surfed into the lake adjacent to the stage after saying "I think it's a nice day for a swim". Staff Notes: The setlist for this show is believed to be complete. Crumbling Castle and The Dripping Tap have been confirmed via audio/video recordings. The remaining songs were confirmed via contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (guest appearances, segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net.

This show featured the debut of Ambergris. Robot Stop contained Hot Water teases. Cut Throat Boogie contained Boogieman Sam teases. Honey contained Rattlesnake teases. Float Along - Fill Your Lungs contained a metal jam. Staff Notes: The setlist for this show is believed to be complete. Self-Immolate, Ambergris through Open Water, and Float Along - Fill Your Lungs have been confirmed via audio/video recordings. The remaining songs were confirmed via contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (guest appearances, segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net.

This show was part of the 2022 Bonnaroo Music & Arts Festival and was held in “That Tent”. Robot Stop was played as an homage to the live debut of Robot Stop at Bonnaroo in 2015 and contained Hot Water teases. Following Planet B, Joey shouted out Tool, who was also playing at the festival (but on a different day to his chagrin) and then teased The Grudge (Tool). Gaia featured a drum solo by Cavs. Magenta Mountain contained Crumbling Castle teases. Work This Time featured a guitar solo. The Dripping Tap contained Dazed and Confused (Led Zeppelin) teases. This show was released through the Official Bootlegger program as Live at Bonnaroo ‘22.

Rattlesnake contained Automation and O.N.E. teases. Am I In Heaven? contained Magenta Mountain and Head On/Pill teases, Alter Me and Crumbling Castle teases and quotes, and both a Dripping Tap and Hypertension jam with lyrics. KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist for this show is believed to be complete. Hot Water, Magenta Mountain, and most of Am I In Heaven? have been confirmed via audio/video recordings. The remaining songs were confirmed via the physical written setlist for the night and contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (guest appearances, segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete or incorrect. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlist@kglw.net.

This show was part of the 2022 Desert Daze Festival (held on Moreno Beach at the Lake Perris State Recreation Area) and featured the live debut of Iron Lung. Gaia featured a Cavs drum solo. Boogieman Sam contained Cut Throat Boogie, “Got My Mojo Working” (Ann Cole) quotes, and “My Babe” (Little Walter) quotes. Following Murder of the Universe the band shouted out Tame Impala, who also appeared at the festival. Following K.G.L.W. (Outro), Joey called out “our other best friends Mild High Club”, who were also playing that night, and Ambrose got them confused with Mildlife, another group the band was friends with playing the festival the next day. Float Along - Fill Your Lungs had a false start due to Stu's guitar being out of tune and contained a metal jam. The Dripping Tap was introduced as a song “about swimming in a sea of death”, and during the song Stu crowd surfed to and swam in Lake Perris, then crowd surfed back to the stage. The song contained Torture Chamber quotes.

This show featured the live debut of Magma. Gaia featured a Cavs drum solo. The Garden Goblin was introduced by Cookie as a song that he wrote about his dog. Leah Senior was shouted out after Magma. Rattlesnake contained Doom City, O.N.E., Honey, Nuclear Fusion, Billabong Valley, & Automation teases and quotes and Sleep Drifter teases.

Poster Art by Jason Galea
130 Standard / 30 Foil Print

Sleep Drifter contained Honey quotes and teases and O.N.E., Billabong Valley, and Rattlesnake teases. Ambrose quoted “Fuck tha Police” (N.W.A) in Billabong Valley. Gaia featured a Cavs drum solo. Leah Senior was shouted out before Magma. Poster by Jason Galea 220 Standard / 30 Foil

An I In Heaven? was teased prior to Magenta Mountain. The intro to O.N.E. contained Straws in the Wind teases. The River contained Wah Wah teases and quotes throughout, as well as Crumbling Castle teases. The Land Before Timeland was played over the PA as the setbreak music, which incidentally served as the “debut” for the studio track. Rattlesnake contained teases and quotes from O.N.E., Automation, Honey, and Minimum Brain Size, and teases of Sleep Drifter. Honey contained teases of Sleep Drifter and Billabong Valley. The Reticent Raconteur through The Balrog featured Leah Senior (introduced as “The Balrog” and “the best singer”) providing the narration. Ambrose quoted “Happy Birthday, Lisa” (The Simpsons) while referencing Joey’s “Australian birthday” prior to The Grim Reaper. The Grim Reaper was then introduced as “some weird-ass Satanic rap”. Venusian 2 and Am I in Heaven? were on the printed setlist but were replaced with Planet B due to time constraints. This show was released through the Official Bootlegger program as part of Live at Red Rocks ‘22. Poster By Jason Galea This is the first edition of this print

The start of the show was delayed by 4-5 minutes due to issues with Stu’s guitar/equipment. There was much humorous banter from the band during the delay. Gaia featured a Cavs drum solo over a metal vamp from the band. The segue from O.N.E. to Sleep Drifter contained a Honey tease. Let Me Mend The Past contained an It Ain't Me, Babe (Bob Dylan) quote. Only Parts I, II, and III of The River were performed and they contained an Am I In Heaven? tease and a Wah Wah tease. The River [Part III] was reprised during Wah Wah, which also contained a quote of The River. Poster By Carlo Vivary

The show opened with a brief drum solo by Cavs prior to the rest of the band taking the stage. History owner (Drake) (“Champagne Papi”) was mentioned a number of times over the course of the show. Rattlesnake contained O.N.E. and Automation quotes and teases. Ambrose crowd surfed while singing the refrain in Straws in the Wind. Joey introduced Anoxia as “my Neil Young impersonation song.” Ice V was introduced as being “in memory of Queen E.” Prior to Digital Black, Joey said "hello" numerous times in a Han-Tyumi impression. Soy-Protein Munt Machine and Vomit Coffin contained Hypertension teases. The Dripping Tap contained an I’m in Your Mind Fuzz Suite tease. KGLW.net Staff Notes: The recordings of this show are incomplete (missing Digital Black). KGLW.net staff do have enough to confirm the > into Han-Tyumi and that Ice V came to a full stop. For the show opening drum solo, it was discussed whether this should be added to the setlist as “Fury” in order to match with the show opening drum solo from the Melbourne ‘21 bootlegger release. It was decided that the drum solos labeled “Fury” by the band consist of a distinct double bass drum part which is absent from this drum solo and that other drum solos have been given different names (i.e. “Parking” on Chunky Shrapnel), therefore it was decided to leave this drum solo as a show note since we do not have definitive information on what it should be called. If anyone has any further information about these items, or ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net. Poster By Carlo Vivary

Honey contained Sleep Drifter and Rattlesnake teases. The Sleep Drifter outro -> to O.N.E. contained Billabong Valley teases. Leah Senior and Black Midi were shouted out after O.N.E. Gaia featured a Cavs drum solo over a metal vamp from the band, which also contained People-Vultures teases. After the solo, Joey lamented that they didn’t have another drum set to hold a drum battle between Cavs and Morgan of Black Midi. Iron Lung contained Hypertension teases.

Posters By Jason Galea
Show: 555 Standard / 55 Foil Print
Record Fair: 100 Standard Print
data.soundcheck: Magenta Mountain w/ attempted > The Grim Reaper

data.shownotes:
The show began with a drum solo leading into Venusian 2. Before Predator X, an “Asheville Gatherum” shirt was thrown on stage, and Stu changed into it. Slow Jam 1 contained Ice V and Magenta Mountain teases. Magenta Mountain was dedicated to Robert “Bob” Moog, inventor of the Moog synthesizer. Nuclear Fusion featured Lucas on the intro vocal. Another t-shirt was thrown up on stage after Iron Lung; Stu thanked everyone for the t-shirts noting that “I fucking stink like shit so it’s perfect.” After Stu declared that “showers are for squares,” Ambrose then suggested that Stu had never had a shower in his life, “only golden ones.” Wah Wah contained a The River intro, as well as teases and quotes. The Dripping Tap contained The Land Before Timeland teases.

Poster By Lewy Jones

Evil Death Roll did not include the Invisible Face section and instead featured a Hypertension-esque jam (see below). The intro to Ambergris featured musical banter regarding a “big-ass beer”. Leah Senior was shouted out prior to Crumbling Castle. KGLW.net Staff Notes: There was a good deal of discussion about whether the jam in Evil Death Roll constituted a Hypertension tease or was merely suggesting a variation on Hypertension through Stu’s playing. We decided that this example did not qualify as a “tease”, “quote”, or full “jam.” Rather than expand our lexicon to include “motif” or “theme,” we opted to simply mention and qualify it in the setlist notes. Poster By Jordan Speer

Rattlesnake contained Sleep Drifter teases. The outro to Sleep Drifter contained Honey quotes before returning to the earlier Rattlesnake jam. Before Pleura, the band shouted out The Murlocs (with Cavs filling in on drums) for killing it prior to their set. Before Gaia, it was noted that Fishing for Fishies had been recorded by Gareth Liddiard of Tropical Fuck Storm. Gaia featured a Cavs drum solo over a metal vamp from the band. Before The Dripping Tap, Joey again shouted out The Murlocs, Leah Senior, and “Tropical Fuck Cunts”. KGLW.net Staff Notes: For those wondering about the nature of the show-opening Rattlesnake sequence, the band is jamming on Rattlesnake themes before an immediate and natural transition to Honey, which is immediately followed by a segue into Sleep Drifter that contains elements of Honey all the way through, and finally a return to the bridge and “Rattle, rattle, rattle” portion of the preceding Rattlesnake jam, thus completing the “Snake Sandwich”.

data.footnote: With a lyric changed to reference the events of Willy Wonka and the Chocolate Factory
data.shownotes: “Theme from Halloween” was played over the PA prior to the costumed band members walking on stage to a song played over the PA: "P.I.M.P" (50 Cent) for Ambrose, dressed as a pimp, "Mother" (Danzig) for Cavs, dressed as Glenn Danzig, "You've Got a Friend in Me" (Randy Newman) for Lucas, dressed as Buzz Lightyear, ""C" is for Cookie" (Sesame Street) for Cook, dressed as a cookie, with him throwing cookies into the crowd, "Oompa Loompa (#1)" (Willy Wonka & the Chocolate Factory) for Joey, dressed as an Oompa Loompa, and "Hollaback Girl" (Gwen Stefani) for Stu, dressed as a banana and throwing bananas into the crowd. Additionally, crew for the show were dressed as ketchup and mustard bottles. Robot Stop contained a Hot Water tease. Alter Me was teased during the intro to People-Vultures. Mr. Beat contained a Persistence tease. Before Alter Me II, there was an extended discussion about bananas. Alter Me II through Altered Beast IV were performed with Leah Senior (dressed as a witch) providing the narration. The verses were sung out of order in Altered Beast IV. Let Me Mend The Past contained an It Ain't Me, Babe (Bob Dylan) quote. Before Doom City, Stu denied a fan request for Catching Smoke saying that they didn’t know how to play it. Magenta Mountain featured a lyric change to reference Willy Wonka and the Chocolate Factory. Stu removed the banana costume prior to Self-Immolate and threw it into the crowd, citing that it was “too hot”. Gaia featured a Cavs drum solo over a metal vamp from the band in which Ambrose destroyed pumpkins that were on stage and threw the pieces into the crows. Poster by Jake Foreman

Wah Wah contained The River intro. Hypertension contained a “Hells Bells” (AC/DC) intro. Work This Time contained a guitar solo. Predator X was listed on the written setlist between Planet B and Hell, but was not played except for a drum beat reminiscent of the intro. Gaia featured a drum solo by Cavs. Poster By Mr. Joe Johnson
People-Vultures contained a “Down With the Sickness” (Disturbed) quote. Mr. Beat contained The Dripping Tap teases. Automation was dedicated to ChatGPT. Poster By Carlo Vivary

Gaia contained Motor Spirit teases. Her & I (Slow Jam 2) contained Iron Lung quotes and teases. This Thing was played for the first time since Feb. 21, 2020 (94 show gap) and contained The Dripping Tap quotes. Before Magenta Mountain, Stu announced that he was a “dickhead." Joey subsequently changed the lyrics of Magenta Mountain to “I don’t believe Stu”. Robot Stop contained Hot Water and Her & I (Slow Jam 2) teases. During Hot Water Stu took over drums & Cavs crowd surfed. Shanghai, Trapdoor and Evil Death Roll were on the printed setlist but were not played. Poster By Drew Millward

Self-Immolate featured a drum solo by Cavs. Gila Monster was introduced as a track off a new album, after which Stu shouted out drop D tuning. Let Me Mend The Past contained an It Ain't Me, Babe (Bob Dylan) quote. Ice V contained quotes of "Ain’t It Funky Now" and “The Boss” (James Brown). The intro to Gamma Knife contained People-Vultures and Robot Stop teases. Amby quoted “So Long, Farewell” (The Sound of Music) after Iron Lung. Poster By Carlo Vivary

Robot Stop contained Hot Water teases and The Dripping Tap teases/quotes. Hot Water had lyrics changed to “time to party”. Persistence contained Sleepwalker teases. Hypertension contained Ice V teases/quotes. Sadie Sorceress was introduced as a song about Amby’s nana and contained a Crumbling Castle tease and an extra verse from The Grim Reaper. Shanghai was dedicated to orange juice and featured a Grow Wings and Fly 'Lets Get Real High' jam with dub keyboard elements highly reminiscent of The Scientist’s Butterfly 3001 Shanghai remix. Magenta Mountain had lyrics changed to “I don’t believe Stu”. Mars For the Rich was listed on the written setlist after Planet B but was not played. Gaia featured a drum solo by Cavs, during which Amby and Stu laid down on the stage to watch. Poster By Mr. Joe Johnson

This show featured Stu singing lines of "Hey man" and lines about different "animals in Australia" throughout. Sea of Trees contained Shanghai quotes, as well as the "Let’s get real high and eat apple pie” quotes that would become Grow Wings and Fly. The return to Head On/Pill contained The Dripping Tap teases. The return to Sea of Trees featured Ambrose on sax. Iron Lung contained an intro jam similar to that of Lava. Sleep Drifter contained Doom City, Honey and Automation teases. Lucas did the vocal intro to Nuclear Fusion at Joey’s request. This Thing contained an “Incredible” (M Beat) quote and Hot Water teases. Slow Jam 1 contained Ice V and Head On/Pill teases, a Hypertension jam, as well as "sexy alien" lyrics with an “Intergalactic” (Beastie Boys) quote and E.T. references. Gaia was introduced as being called "Hey Man" and contained a Magma tease as well as a Motor Spirit jam and featured a drum solo by Cavs. Poster By Drew Millward

Stu joined the opener Los Bitchos on flute for their cover of Trapdoor. Rattlesnake contained O.N.E. teases and had some of the "rattle, rattle, rattle" refrains changed to "boogie, boogie, boogie". Automation contained a false intro with Cavs playing the drumbeat to Muddy Water. Honey contained Rattlesnake quotes (with the "rattle, rattle, rattle" refrain changed to "Brussels, Brussels, Brussels"), Sleep Drifter teases and O.N.E. teases. An audience member named Mīkal was brought onstage to do the vocal intro to Nuclear Fusion. The O.N.E. intro contained Straws in the Wind teases. Magenta Mountain was introduced as a song about monkeys, then as a song about Lucas. Planet B was introduced as a song about monkeys, then space monkeys and finally "human monkeys". Self-Immolate featured a drum solo by Cavs followed by a brief metal vamp by the band. Planet B and Self-Immolate were dedicated to Michael Badger, a sound engineer/mixer on the studio versions of the tracks. I'm Not In Your Mind contained Witchcraft teases, Am I in Heaven? teases, The Dripping Tap teases/quotes and Hot Water teases/quotes with lyrics changed to "time to party". Cellophane contained "animals in Australia" quotes. The Balrog contained Evil Death Roll teases and Hypertension teases & quotes. Boogieman Sam had some of the "boogie, boogie, boogie" refrains changed to "Brussels, Brussels, Brussels" and contained “Whole Lotta Rosie” (AC/DC) teases, “Got My Mojo Working” (Ann Cole) quotes, “Going Up the Country” (Canned Heat) quotes, “Hells Bells” (AC/DC) teases, "animals in Australia" quotes, and Hypertension teases. Evil Death Roll and Presumptuous were on the printed setlist but were not played. Poster By Mr. Joe Johnson

The Wheel was played for the first time since Dec. 19, 2021 (94 show gap). Alter Me III contained Witchcraft teases. Altered Beast IV contained Converge teases. Sadie Sorceress was dedicated to Ambrose's 99-year-old grandmother and contained an extra verse from The Grim Reaper and quotes of Torture Chamber. Am I In Heaven? contained “animals in Australia” lyrics, Witchcraft teases, Head On/Pill teases, Ice V teases, Hot Water teases, Shanghai teases, The Dripping Tap teases, I Am Not a Man Unless I Have a Woman quotes and Sea of Trees teases. Poster By Jason Galea 100 Standard / 30 Foil

The Dripping Tap contained Cellophane teases. Magenta Mountain was introduced as being about “mountains and stuff” and had lyrics changed to “I don’t believe Stu.” KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist for this show has been confirmed, but only partial recordings exist. The full setlist was confirmed via the available recordings and written setlist for this show as well as contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations for missing or incomplete songs that require audio confirmation (segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net. Poster By Amy Jean 100 Standard / 20 Foil

This show featured the debut of Astroturf. Following the Mind Fuzz suite Amby quoted “Runnin’ With the Devil” (Van Halen). Magenta Mountain had lyrics changed to “I don’t believe Stu, his eyes deceive you.” Magenta Mountain contained a tease of The Grim Reaper. The Grim Reaper contained Torture Chamber quotes and featured an additional verse from Sadie Sorceress. Shanghai was on the printed setlist following The Grim Reaper and was attempted but not played due to technical difficulties. Ice V contained a Blindness (The Fall) jam. Poster By Jason Galea 215 Standard / 80 Foil Print

This show featured the debuts of Motor Spirit and Hate Dancin’. Gaia featured a drum solo by Cavs. Motor Spirit was incomplete. Sense contained Am I In Heaven? teases, Iron Lung quotes, Head On/Pill teases, and a Straws in the Wind vocal jam with “no sense at all” vocals. The Grim Reaper featured “I’m the Shrimp Reaper” vocals and contained Torture Chamber quotes. Following Astroturf, Cavs’ parents briefly appeared on stage. Down the Sink was played for the first time since May 24, 2022 (70 show gap) and had lyrics changed to “the street is where people jam.” Robot Stop contained Hot Water and The Dripping Tap teases and quotes, an Extinction quote, and a proto-Grow Wings and Fly jam. Gamma Knife contained Motor Spirit teases. Iron Lung contained Sense teases. Poster By Jason Galea 1200 Standard / 300 Foil Prints

This show featured the debut of Change. Plastic Boogie was played for the first time since June 5, 2022 (74 show gap) and contained a Black Dog (Led Zeppelin) outro. Prior to The Garden Goblin Joey teased the commercial theme for Bunnings Warehouse, an Australian home improvement store. The Garden Goblin was then introduced by Cookie as a song about the time his dog snuck into a Bunnings. The Dripping Tap contained Cellophane teases. Hot Wax was on the printed setlist but was not played. Hot Water and Hypertension were on the printed setlist after The Garden Goblin but were moved up to keep the band’s synth equipment out of the rain. This show was released through the Official Bootlegger program as part of Live in Chicago '23. KGLW.net staff note: There was much internal discussion as to a potential tease of the intro to Gondii in Change. The arrangement of instruments and structure of Change has been modified compared with the studio version. Though it resembles a tease of Gondii, we believe more live instances need to he heard to determine if this is intentional, or just an accentuation of the existing relationship between the songs. Poster By Jason Galea 460 Standard / 130 Foil

This was a three-hour marathon show and the first marathon show to be performed as a single set. The show opened with a video of Amby's father, Broderick Smith, introducing the band. Eyes Like the Sky through Evil Man was dedicated to Broderick Smith and featured Broderick’s narration from the Eyes Like the Sky album played over the PA while the band played, and photos of Broderick displayed on the large screen behind the band. Eyes Like the Sky, Year Of Our Lord, and The Raid were played for the first time since December 1, 2018 (192 show gap). Evil Man was played for the first time since February 18, 2016 (449 show gap). Prior to Gaia, Joey quoted “I Love L.A.” (Randy Newman). The Grim Reaper contained Torture Chamber quotes and “Intergalactic” (Beastie Boys) quotes. During the drum solo by Cavs following Astroturf the rest of the band left the stage, then returned and performed a metal vamp over the end of the solo. Shanghai featured the Grow Wings and Fly “let’s get real high” jam. Ambergris featured an extended intro during which Joey and Amby contemplated the nature of sexiness. The Dripping Tap was dedicated by Amby to Cavs’ dad and to his “first music teacher who said my voice sounds weird,” and contained Cellophane teases and Hot Water teases.
Evil Death Roll contained Converge and Chang'e teases. The Grim Reaper contained Torture Chamber quotes and "Intergalactic” (Beastie Boys) quotes. Poster By Emy Rojas

This show featured the debut of Kepler-22b. Gamma Knife contained a People-Vultures tease. KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist for this show is believed to be complete. Magenta Mountain, Kepler-22b, Straws In the Wind, Magma, Gamma Knife, Iron Lung, and Han-Tyumi through Murder of the Universe have been confirmed via audio/video recordings. The remaining songs were confirmed via the written setlist for the show and contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (guest appearances, segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net. Poster By Jessica Rassi 130 Printed

This show was cut short due to heavy winds at the festival site. The band (except Cavs) wore pilot uniforms for the full show. Prior to Gaia, Amby did a vocal tease of “Tequila” (The Champs). Gaia featured a drum solo by Cavs which led into a Motor Spirit jam. During Mars For The Rich a confetti cannon went off prompting Stu to sing "What the fuck is happening?" Am I In Heaven? contained Supreme Ascendancy quotes. The Grim Reaper contained "Intergalactic” (Beastie Boys) quotes and an appearance on stage by a dancing People-Vulture. KGLW.net Staff Notes: The setlist for this show is believed to be complete. Gaia through The Grim Reaper have been confirmed via audio/video recordings. The remaining songs were confirmed via the written setlist for the show and contemporaneous discussions through various social media, but any additional setlist notations that require audio confirmation (guest appearances, segues, quotes or teases) may be incomplete. If anyone has any further information or, ideally, a complete or conclusive recording please contact KGLW.net staff at setlists@kglw.net.

The Grim Reaper featured “I’m the Shrimp Reaper” vocals and contained quotes of Torture Chamber, Sadie Sorceress, "Intergalactic” (Beastie Boys) and “One, Two, Freddy’s Coming For You” (A Nightmare on Elm Street) with lyrics changed to “Shrimpy’s coming for you.” Static Electricity was introduced as a song about the time Stu almost got electrocuted in Thailand. O.N.E. contained Straws In The Wind teases. Boogieman Sam contained Rattlesnake quotes, The Bitter Boogie teases and quotes; “La Grange” (ZZ Top) teases and quotes, “Going Up the Country” (Canned Heat) quotes, The Dripping Tap teases, “Whole Lotta Rosie” (AC/DC) teases and “Tutti Frutti” (Little Richard) quotes. The Dripping Tap contained Hell's Itch teases and a Witchcraft jam. Poster By Job van Rijen
The Dripping Tap contained Hypertension teases. Hypertension contained Witchcraft teases. This Thing contained an “Incredible” (M Beat) quote and Hot Water teases. Gaia featured a drum solo by Cavs.

data.jamchart_notes: Technical difficulties lead into an improvised jam instead of a traditional Magenta Mountain
data.shownotes:
Audience member Joe did the vocal intro to Nuclear Fusion. Cellophane contained I'm In Your Mind, Am I In Heaven?, and Lord of Lightning teases. Mystery Jack was last played 2022-05-31. (138 show gap) Hypertension contained Witchcraft and Hot Water teases. Ambrose did a short breakdance after his verse of Le Risque and said Raygun taught him everything he knows. The Grim Reaper contained Telescope (Ambrose Kenny-Smith & GUM), Torture Chamber, Body Movin' and Intergalactic (Beastie Boys) quotes. Magenta Mountain was attempted but only a jam was played (Titled We're Doin' It Together on the Official Bootleg) because Joey's synth wasn't working. This Thing contained a The Land Before Timeland tease. The intro to Am I In Heaven? (which was not on the printed setlist) contained Lava and The Dripping Tap teases and the song itself contained a This Thing tease and a Hypertension jam with lyrics. 

Poster By Job van Rijen
Standard: 600
Gold Foil: 200

The Dripping Tap had a lyric changed to "Times of our Milwaukee" and a Le Risque quote. Hot Water contained teases of Am I In Heaven? and The Dripping Tap. God Is Calling Me Back Home was last played 2015-06-12. (580 show gap) Before The Garden Goblin, the band congratulated Cookie on the Pipe-eye single that released the night before. Magenta Mountain contained a Crumbling Castle tease. Chang'e contained Magenta Mountain teases and quotes and Witchcraft quotes. Extinction contained Magenta Mountain quotes. Billabong Valley contained Sleep Drifter teases. The intro to Honey contained Sleep Drifter teases.

Poster By Job van Rijen
Standard: 500
Gold Foil: 150

Amby joined opener Geese on 3D Country. Cellophane featured Ambrose on sax. Self-Immolate featured a drum solo with Riff Raff (AC/DC) teases from Stu ending in a Moby Dick (Led Zeppelin) tease. Motor Spirit was dedicated to everyone on the highway. Gilgamesh contained Gila Monster quotes. Set contained Gilgamesh quotes. Nuclear Fusion featured Hunter, an audience member, on the intro. Ataraxia, which was last played 2023-08-16 (54 show gap), had its lyrics changed to "I am a father now”. Field of Vision was dedicated to Jess Lewis (the band's tour manager who is mention in the song). Raw Feel contained a Sympathy For The Devil (The Rolling Stones) quote. Lava was last played 2023-06-03 (71 show gap) and did not contain the intro. Before Antarctica, Joey shouted out opener Geese and Stu was handed a fox mask, which he put on followed by a full band tease of Foxey Lady (Jimi Hendrix). Joey quoted Billy Madison as the song started “Extra Sloppy for ya.”

Poster by Amy Jean

Rattlesnake contained Automation and Sleep Drifter teases, Boogieman Sam quotes and Nuclear Fusion teases. O.N.E. and Sleep Drifter featured Stu on microtonal acoustic guitar. Open Water contained a Chang’e tease. The Lord of Lightning contained an Ice V tease. The Balrog contained a Cellophane tease. Before Hog Calling Contest, Joey mentioned that the band saw Dom Dolla at The Gorge the night before. Joe then asked the crowd to pretend to call hogs, and then invited sound manager Joe Santarpia to do the same. Stu then picked up an Intrasport shirt from a fan and told them they weren't playing it at the show, but would next tour, followed be an Intrasport tease. Flight b741 contained a false start due to Amby playing in the wrong key. Ice V contained a Head On/Pill tease and a Down Under (Men At Work) tease on drums. Dirt through Let Me Mend The Past featured Joey on acoustic guitar. Dirt conained a “Taylor” (Jack Johnson) tease. Mirage City was introduced as Paradise City (Guns N' Roses) followed by a Welcome to the Jungle quote from Amby. During Let Me Mend The Past, Ambrose crowdsurfed on an inflatable boat. Following Le Risque, Joey shouted out Jackson Devereux and Allen Dobbins (the stream film crew). Gondii contained a Dragon quote. The Silver Cord contained Extinction quotes. Daily Blues was quoted before Venusian 1, which was stopped halfway through due to the barricade being broken. During the stop, Joey called his mom and Stu and Joey sung part of Vegemite acapella, which was "performed" for the first time since 2016-05-14. Gaia, which was incomplete, featured a drum solo with a Motor Spirit tease. The Great Chain of Being was incomplete. Gaia Outro was on the printed setlist after Motor Spirit, but was cut. Poster by Jason Galea Normal - 2500 Foil - 500

data.jamchart_notes: Elaborate intro with multiple unique jams.
data.shownotes: Hot Water contained Daily Blues teases and a Robot Stop snippet as the outro. Gamma Knife contained a Motor Spirit jam with lyrics. People-Vultures contained Iron Lung teases. Sad Pilot contained Daily Blues teases. Rats In The Sky contained an ad-libbed line “got myself some chicken wings.”The Bitter Boogie contained many Muddy Water teases in the intro, as well as the drums from Muddy Water, and had the first 2 verses swapped. Muddy Water had the drums from The Bitter Boogie. Mirage City contained an intro jam and an alternate slower outro. The Grim Reaper contained a Get Low (Lil Jon) quote with the lyrics changed to "To the window, To Arkansas" and a Hog Calling Contest quote. Magenta Mountain contained an extended intro. Flamethrower was introduced as a song about a dragon setting the world on fire.

data.jamchart_notes: Full on metal jam at the end with Grim Reaper jam
data.shownotes: Rattlesnake contained Nuclear Fusion, O.N.E. and Automation teases and Honey teases & quotes. Ice V contained Mirage City teases. Hog Calling Contest featured Joey on acoustic guitar. Following Set Amby quoted She'll Be Coming 'Round the Mountain (traditional).  Magenta Mountain contained The Grim Reaper quotes.

data.jamchart_notes: This Magenta Mountain expertly toed the line between synthy jam and high energy rager. It featured a metronome click and a transition into The Grim Reaper.
data.shownotes: Supreme Ascendancy was played for the first time since 2023-08-16 (84 shows). The Lord of Lightning contained Am I In Heaven? and I'm In Your Mind teases. The Balrog contained Forty Six & 2 (Tool) and Am I In Heaven? teases. You Can Be Your Silhouette was introduced as a song about "being who you want to be and loving yourself." Cut Throat Boogie featured a harmonica/guitar duel between Ambrose and Joey and contained a La Grange (ZZ Top) jam and The Bitter Boogie teases. Daily Blues contained a Le Risque jam and Boogieman Sam teases. The Grim Reaper contained H.O.O.D (Kneecap) and Intergalactic (Beastie Boys) quotes and Ambrose saying Free Palestine. Following The Grim Reaper, Joey said it was "our nu-metal moment", which was followed by Cavs teasing and Joey quoting My Generation (Limp Bizkit). Following Superbug, Joey shouted out opener Etran de L'Aïr and mentioned an afterparty happening later and Ambrose mentioned playing songs by Australian musicians Slim Dusty, John Farnham and Jimmy Barnes. Following Flamethrower, Joey said Free Palestine.
data.venuename: Plaza Mayor de El Poble Espanyol

data.shownotes: This show featured the debuts of Jailbreak (AC/DC) and the synth outro of Flamethrower. Ambrose sung along to the walkout music, which was Party All the Time (Eddie Murphy). Antarctica contained Hot Water and Forty Six and 2 (Tool) teases. Before Hypertension, the band talked about Stu's new guitar, mentioning Jimi Hendrix and Dimebag Darrell, and joking that they wanted to play Little Wing on the table, but Cavs said no because he wanted to play Foxy Lady and Cookie wanted to play She's So Fine. Boogieman Sam was teased before Ice V, which contained Blindness (The Fall) teases. Ambrose quoted “Good day, good evening, and good night!” from The Truman Show before Rats In The Sky. Jailbreak was impromptu/not on the written setlist, unfinished, and contained a Rats In the Sky outro. The Fourth Colour was on the printed setlist after Crumbling Castle but was not played.
data.soundcheck: Motor Spirit, Crumbling Castle > The Fourth Colour

data.shownotes: The Wheel was last played on 2024-05-29 (61 shows). Most Of What I Like was last played on 2024-05-31 (59 show gap). God Is Calling Me Back Home contained Green River (Creedence Clearwater Revival) and Le Risque teases. Le Risque was performed without the typical break between Cavs' and Ambrose's verses. Hog Calling Contest featured sound tech Joe Santarpia, whose birthday it was, doing pig noises. Most Of What I Like contained a Praise You (Fatboy Slim) jam. The Wheel contained Magma teases in the intro. Plastic Boogie contained a Happy Birthday To You tease. Following the song, the band thanked the crowd, everyone who followed them on tour, opening band King Stingray (who were invited onto stage), the crew, and Jason Galea. Hot Wax was introduced as a song by Jason Galea. Venusian 2 contained Hot Wax teases. Following Motor Spirit the band shouted out Allen and Jackson from the stream crew. Rattlesnake contained teases of Billabong Valley and Cellophane. At the end of the show, Ambrose quoted Nookie (Limp Bizkit).

data.jamchart_notes: This Magenta Mountain continues the trend of magenta mountain on the table with vocoder vocals and leads into some spacey sections. Before transitioning into Grim Reaper we get some seamless magma teases.
data.shownotes: Slow Jam 1 featured Ambrose on saxophone and contained an Am I In Heaven? tease. Empty was performed for the first time since 2014-12-19 (644 show gap), and was performed with flute for the first time. Hot Wax was played by request of Wayne Gordon (who recorded I'm In Your Mind Fuzz and Quarters! at Daptone Studios and made a brief appearance on stage) and contained an Am I In Heaven? tease. A fan named Callum was brought onto stage to play Superbug on Stu's guitar instead of Stu. Magenta Mountain contained Forty Six & 2 (Tool) and Magma teases. The Grim Reaper contained Forty Six & 2 (Tool) teases and Intergalactic, Sabotage (both Beastie Boys), and Torture Chamber quotes. Following The Grim Reaper, Joey said he was ripping off Wes Borland (of Limp Bizkit), and Ambrose said he needed a red hat (Fred Durst's signature hat). Swan Song contained Magenta Mountain teases and quotes. Le Risque featured Jay Weinberg on drums instead of Cavs. Ice V featured Joey on flute during the intro and contained a quote of Aqualung (Jethro Tull) and teases of Ants & Bats and Blindness (The Fall). Raw Feel contained Am I In Heaven? teases. Hot Water contained I'm In Your Mind and Robot Stop teases.  Following Hot Water, Joey shouted out festival act The Mystery Lights, saying they were the first band they co-headlined with in America. Boogieman Sam contained The Bitter Boogie, Whole Lotta Rosie (AC/DC) and Riff Raff (AC/DC) teases. During Straws In The Wind, Ambrose walked through the crowd to Jason at the soundboard and when he returned to stage, he did an impression of Fred Durst. After Straws In The Wind, the band pretended it was Jason's birthday and sang Happy Birthday to him. During Pleura, Joey said "Fuck Donald Trump", with Ambrose responding "Juicy [Jason] for President!" Dimathaya Burarrwanga and Yimila Gurruwiwi from King Stingray joined the band for Rattlesnake on yiḏaki (didgeridoo), and Dimathaya quoted Treaty (Yothu Yindi). At the end of the show, Joey said Free Palestine and Ambrose led the crowd in a chant of "Free Free Palestine".

This show featured the debut of Hell's Itch, which was also the synth version and contained Joey's and Stu's final verses only, and "LUSEQ". Theia contained a Hot Water tease from Stu on electric flute. Hot Water contained The Dripping Tap teases. Slow Jam 1 contained a Hell's Itch jam. Hell's Itch contained a substantial lyrical portion of Pure Shores (All Saints) before reprising the "finally red" chorus. Murder of the Universe was performed in an electronic version for the first time.

This show featured the debut of Dreams. 2.02 Killer Year contained Shanghai teases. Shanghai contained Grow Wings and Fly teases and quotes, as well as the "let's get real high" refrain. Kepler-22b had it's lyrics changed to "dancin' is good for ya". At the end of the show, Joey said Free Palestine. The Silver Cord was on the printed setlist as the final song but was skipped for time.

Kepler-22b contained a lyric change to "dancin' is good for ya". Magenta Mountain contained Magma teases.  The Bitter Boogie contained Muddy Water quotes and Extinction teases. Hot Water contained The Dripping Tap and Hell teases. Gilgamesh was labeled "Frankenstein" on the printed setlist.
